Generation IV.Diamond: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
Generation IV.Pearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
Generation IV.Platinum: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude . Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude . Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

Generation V.Black: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
Generation V.White: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
Generation V.Black 2: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
Generation V.White 2: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.

Generation VI.X: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
Generation VI.Y: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

Generation VIII.Sword: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
Generation VIII.Shield: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. On rare occasions, the Pokémon even shoots out Geodude.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. On rare occasions, the Pokémon even shoots out Geodude.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon's sturdy carapace protects it from volcanic eruptions. It shoots round rocks from the holes in its hands.
Generation IX.Violet: A Rhyperior's brain is smaller than a Rhydon's, but the Rhyperior is stronger because it spends more energy on battling and less on brainpower.

Generation VIII.Sword: Bridge Field , Dusty Bowl , Giant's Seat , Rolling Fields ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Bridge Field , Dusty Bowl , Giant's Seat , Rolling Fields ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Potbottom Desert ( Wanderer ) Fields of Honor ( Max Raid Battle )
